intro: Psoralea tenuiflora var. floribunda, commonly known as the slender-flowered psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, elliptical pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This variety is notable for its compact growth habit and is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
